popular.description: By using our knowledge of supplementary, adjacent, and vertical angles, we can solve problems involving the intersection of two lines. Including this one!
popular.title: Intro to vertical angles

popular.description: Given algebraic expressions that represent a pair of two vertical angles, Sal forms and solves an equation.
popular.title: Equation practice with vertical angles

popular.description: Given algebraic expressions that represent a pair of two vertical angles, form and solve an equation.
popular.title: Equation practice with vertical angles

popular.description: Proving that vertical angles are equal
popular.title: Vertical angles are congruent proof

popular.description: Sal draws two parallel lines and a transversal, then introduces some new vocabulary.
popular.title: Angles, parallel lines, & transversals

popular.description: Sal identifies parallel and perpendicular lines in geometric figures.
popular.title: Parallel & perpendicular lines

popular.description: Sal draws two parallel lines and a transversal, then finds some missing angle measurements.
popular.title: Missing angles with a transversal

popular.description: Determine which angles must be congruent when parallel lines are crossed by a transversal.
popular.title: DEPRECATED Congruent angles

popular.description: Proof by contradiction that corresponding angle equivalence implies parallel lines
popular.title: Parallel lines & corresponding angles proof

popular.description: Find missing angles given two parallel lines and a transversal.
popular.title: Parallel lines

popular.description: Sal solves an equation to find missing angles given two parallel lines and a transversal.
popular.title: Measures of angles formed by a transversal

popular.description: Sal proves that two angles are congruent in a really interesting triangle like figure.
popular.title: Proving angles are congruent

popular.description: Explore different ways of proving some theorems about lines and angles. Some transformations are used.
popular.title: Line & angle proofs

review.description: Understanding that the derivative is just the slope of a curve at a point (or the slope of the tangent line)
review.title: Derivative as slope of a tangent line

review.description: The slope of a tangent line can be expressed as the limit of certain secant lines.
review.title: Tangent slope example 1

review.description: Test your understanding of a tangent line as the limit of secant slopes.
review.title: Tangent slope

review.description: The derivative can be thought of the slope of a tangent line, which is defined as the limit of the slopes of certain secant lines.  See what this looks like in action.
review.title: Slope of tangent line using derivative definition

review.description: Here we find a formula for the derivative of f(x)=x^2.
review.title: The derivative of f(x)=x^2 for any x

review.description: Compare different (equivalent) definitions for the derivative.
review.title: Formal and alternate form of the derivative

review.description: Enough abstract stuff already, let's see what the formal and alternative forms of the derivative look like in practice.
review.title: Formal and alternate form of the derivative for ln x

review.description: A practice problem applying the different forms of the derivative.
review.title: Formal and alternate form of the derivative example

review.description: Test your understanding of each definition of the derivative
review.title: The formal and alternate form of the derivative

next.description: Sal gives a formal proof that the measures of interior angles of a triangle sum to 180°.
next.title: Angles in a triangle sum to 180° proof

next.description: Figuring out angles in a triangle. A little about exterior angles being the sum of the remote interior angles
next.title: Triangle angle example

next.description: Another example finding angles in triangles
next.title: Triangle angle example 2

next.description: Multiple ways to solve for the angles of multiple triangles
next.title: Triangle angle example 3

next.description: Interesting problem finding the sums of particular exterior angles of an irregular pentagon
next.title: Triangle angle challenge problem

next.description: Proof by contradiction that corresponding angle equivalence implies parallel lines
next.title: Parallel lines & corresponding angles proof
